meanings.definition: To have control or power over
meanings.sent1: The king can dominate his kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The bully tried to dominate the playground.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it can dominate the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm will dominate the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice can dominate the classroom.

meanings.definition: To be the most important or prominent
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the main character will dominate the scenes.
meanings.sent2: Her bright personality tends to dominate the room.
meanings.sent3: The colorful flowers dominate the garden.
meanings.sent4: The sun will dominate the sky at noon.
meanings.sent5: The tallest building will dominate the skyline.

meanings.definition: To be the most influential or powerful in a particular situation
meanings.sent1: The CEO will dominate the boardroom meeting.
meanings.sent2: Her ideas always dominate the group discussions.
meanings.sent3: The champion boxer will dominate the ring.
meanings.sent4: The queen's presence will dominate the event.
meanings.sent5: The star player can dominate the game with skill.
